comments.text:
+Maiken G While things are improving, here is why:
- Name how often you can walk in public (particularly a university) and 
pick out male/female conversations. You will notice women rarely talk about 
tech, programming, engineering, etc. However, they thrive in humanities, 
communications, etc.
- Look through lists of the most ground breaking technological advances. In 
the recent 100 years, you will find a couple by women, but the vast 
majority are by men. I am not saying women are not capable but they are 
generally less interested.
- Physical strength: no explanation needed (average muscle mass, bone 
density, and testosterone levels are much greater in men).
- Manual labor - again, no explanation needed because much of it is related 
to physical strength.
- Aggressive negotiating. There are actual women advocating the ban of 
things like salary negotiation because there is data supporting that men 
are better at negotiating higher salaries. Aka, be more aggressive about it 
women.
- Politics: Often female politicians have the female population in mind 
rather than everyone. Equal opportunity for EVERYONE is equality. Not 
boosted opportunity for women and ethnic minority groups. It is hard to 
take female politicians seriously that only have a female agenda.
- Euler, Pythagoras, Newton, Einstein, Schwartz, Euclid, Pascal, Ulam, 
karman, Fourier, Gauss, Bernoulli, Neumann, Lagrange, Leibniz, Bayes, 
Hilbert, etc... Aka a bunch of men that you can thank for inventing a huge 
portion of the tools needed in pretty much every field of science. 

I am not anti women, but I do not believe that women inherently have the 
same drive for technological advancement. They are generally more nurturing 
and social. You don't apply to college and get assigned a discipline, you 
choose a program and apply for it. This means that even though there are 
often more women than men in college, they are not choosing the harder 
tech/science majors because they still often have male:female ratios of 2:1 
or higher. 

So yes, at the moment, I fell men are more powerful than women. I do think 
that modern living allowing for more independence and there being less need 
to reproduce will lead to more balance but we haven't even had a full 
century of women really getting involved in everything, so naturally their 
accomplishments are not going to be anywhere near equal because they need 
time for new generations to start new trends.
